data.title: Local gem with excellent food
data.text: We dine here frequently - in restaurant or takeout. Service has never disappointed us. Consistent quality of the food. It is an excellent choice for vegetarians - several options on the menu and all are great. Prawn and chicken stir-fry plates are very good as well. For a small place, they have a surprising decent wine selection

data.title: Nice atmosphere - no Thai spice
data.text:
My colleague and I were staying at the Embassy Suites in Milpitas and wanted to find a restaurant within walking distance.  When we walked in, the atmosphere was pleasant and the air was filled with aromas of spice.  The service was prompt.

I chose the Crispy Rolls as an appetizer and they were delicious!  I had high expectations for the Mussamun Curry, but when it arrived I was disappointed.  The food was bland; not at all what you expect from a Thai restaurant.  As I thought about our ordering experience, I recall that the server did not ask about my preference for the heat of the dish (mild, medium, hot), and it seems they forgot the spice all together.

We listened to the same repeating track of music for more than 40 minutes.  It wasn't bad music, but it started to get old after about 15 minutes.  

Overall, the restaurant seemed clean and the atmosphere was comfortable, but the food left me feeling disenchanted.

data.title: quality and quantity going down
data.text:
When they initially started , food and service was really Good.

Food taste is good , but over the time there quantity started getting less and prices went up.

Also there TO GO Quantity is less.

data.title: Food meh...
data.text:
We went to this restaurant for the first time as we had some coupon. Though the service and ambience were great, the food was very blah. Even the thai iced tea did not taste good. It tasted like sugar water. Flat noodles and fried rice did not taste authentic. Everything tasted ordinary.

Since we have have plenty of options to try, I might not come here again.

data.title: Good and hygienic Thai restaurant
data.text: Good ambience and prompt service. Good interiors . Try the pad Thai and chicken satay . The salad given at the beginning was simple and tasty.

data.title: OK Thai food
data.text:
We came by Honey Thai for lunch after seeing this place in the plaza. It looked like a nice little restaurant from the outside.

We were greeted when we got inside and we asked for a table for 4 which included 2 high chairs. They quickly showed us to a table that wasn't ready. We stood at the table with the kids waiting for some high chairs, but all the waiters and a chef went to a table to solve a problem at another table. It sounded like they made a mistake on one of their dishes. They kept us waiting for long time holding our kids without any seats.

We finally got our seats and sat down. The menu was pretty straight forward with your Pad Thai, curries, and other Thai dishes.

We settled on a Pad Thai, Yellow Curry chicken, and the Roasted Duck. I liked the Pad Thai and the curry was ok. I didn't care for the Roasted Duck because it was quite plain and just seem like it came from the Chinese supermarket.
